about.summary: Flexible and informed regression with Multiple Change Points. 'mcp' can infer change points in means, variances, autocorrelation structure, and any combination of these, as well as the parameters of the segments in between. All parameters are estimated with uncertainty and prediction intervals are supported - also near the change points. 'mcp' supports hypothesis testing via Savage-Dickey density ratio, posterior contrasts, and cross-validation. 'mcp' is described in Lindeløv (submitted) <doi:10.31219/osf.io/fzqxv> and generalizes the approach described in Carlin, Gelfand, & Smith (1992) <doi:10.2307/2347570> and Stephens (1994) <doi:10.2307/2986119>.

Flexible and informed regression with Multiple Change Points. 'mcp' can infer change points in means, variances, autocorrelation structure, and any combination of these, as well as the parameters of the segments in between. All parameters are estimated with uncertainty and prediction intervals are supported - also near the change points. 'mcp' supports hypothesis testing via Savage-Dickey density ratio, posterior contrasts, and cross-validation. 'mcp' is described in Lindeløv (submitted) <doi:10.31219/osf.io/fzqxv> and generalizes the approach described in Carlin, Gelfand, & Smith (1992) <doi:10.2307/2347570> and Stephens (1994) <doi:10.2307/2986119>.

name: r-mcp
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.3.4" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-mcp
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/mcp_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/mcp/mcp_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 074f86438e828b7deccf0f32a3e6d5229348bbe44509e407ab33514e4e8242ed

build:
  number: 2
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/
  missing_dso_whitelist:
    - '*/R.dll'                        # [win]

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip                   # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}        # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-bayesplot >=1.7.0
    - r-coda >=0.19.3
    - r-dplyr >=1.0.0
    - r-future >=1.16
    - r-future.apply >=1.4
    - r-ggplot2 >=3.2.1
    - r-loo >=2.1.0
    - r-magrittr >=1.5
    - r-patchwork >=1.0.0
    - r-rjags >=4.9
    - r-rlang >=0.4.1
    - r-stringr >=1.4.0
    - r-tibble >=2.1.3
    - r-tidybayes >=3.0.0
    - r-tidyr >=1.0.0
    - r-tidyselect >=0.2.5
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-bayesplot >=1.7.0
    - r-coda >=0.19.3
    - r-dplyr >=1.0.0
    - r-future >=1.16
    - r-future.apply >=1.4
    - r-ggplot2 >=3.2.1
    - r-loo >=2.1.0
    - r-magrittr >=1.5
    - r-patchwork >=1.0.0
    - r-rjags >=4.9
    - r-rlang >=0.4.1
    - r-stringr >=1.4.0
    - r-tibble >=2.1.3
    - r-tidybayes >=3.0.0
    - r-tidyr >=1.0.0
    - r-tidyselect >=0.2.5

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('mcp')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('mcp')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://lindeloev.github.io/mcp/
  license: GPL-2.0-only
  summary: "Flexible and informed regression with Multiple Change Points. 'mcp' can infer change points in means, variances, autocorrelation structure, and any combination of these, as well as the parameters of the segments in between. All parameters are estimated with uncertainty and prediction intervals are supported -
    also near the change points. 'mcp' supports hypothesis testing via Savage-Dickey density ratio, posterior contrasts, and cross-validation. 'mcp' is described in Lindeløv (submitted) <doi:10.31219/osf.io/fzqxv> and generalizes the approach described in Carlin, Gelfand, & Smith (1992) <doi:10.2307/2347570> and Stephens
    (1994) <doi:10.2307/2986119>."
  license_family: GPL2
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - leej3

# Description: Flexible and informed regression with Multiple Change Points. 'mcp' can infer change points in means, variances, autocorrelation structure, and any combination of these, as well as the parameters of the segments in between. All parameters are estimated with uncertainty and prediction intervals are supported - also near the change points. 'mcp' supports hypothesis testing via Savage-Dickey density ratio, posterior contrasts, and cross-validation. 'mcp' is described in Lindelv (submitted) <doi:10.31219/osf.io/fzqxv> and generalizes the approach described in Carlin, Gelfand, & Smith (1992) <doi:10.2307/2347570> and Stephens (1994) <doi:10.2307/2986119>.
